element.title: Window
element.longdescription:
Note: Redmond components are deprecated. Please consider using LZ Components. If you use this component, you must explicitly include the redmond library:
<include href="redmond"/>

Arguments:
closeable
default: FALSE
A Boolean that when set to TRUE, creates a window with a standard close button.

fgcolor
default: "#FFFFFF"
A string specifying the color of the window's background.

resizable
default: FALSE
A Boolean that when set to TRUE, creates a window with standard window resizing.

title
default: undefined
A string specifying the text to be displayed in the window's title area.

Description:
The window tag provides a standard Redmond window. A set of compatible window elements are also available including tabpanelview, tabview, windowframe and windowtext.

Example:

<canvas height="220">
    <include href="redmond"/>

    <window x="10" y="10" width="300" height="200">

        <tabpanelview x="5" y="10" clip="true"
                      width="${parent.width-20}" height="${parent.height-62}"
                      oninit="this.setSelected( this.tabOne );">

            <tabview label="Tab 1" name="tabOne" width="45">
                <windowframe x="8" y="10"
                            width="${parent.parent.width-20}" height="${parent.parent.height-40}">
                    <text>This is the contents of tab 1.</text>
                </windowframe>
            </tabview>

            <tabview label="Tab 2" clip="true">
                <text x="5" y="5">First and last name please.</text>
                <windowtext x="5" y="20" width="100">John</windowtext>
                <windowtext x="115" y="20" width="100">Doe</windowtext>
            </tabview>

        </tabpanelview>

    </window>

</canvas>

See also:
tabpanelview, tabview, windowframe, windowtext

attribute.name: title
attribute.desc: A string that is displayed in the title bar of the window.

attribute.name: resource
attribute.desc: If you want a resource to appear in a window, do not use the resource tag. Instead create a view with that resource and embed it in the window tag.

attribute.name: closeable
attribute.desc: If true, the title bar includes a close box.

attribute.name: onclick
attribute.desc: The onclick script is executed when the window is active and the pointing device button is clicked on the window content area.

attribute.name: onmousedown
attribute.desc: The onmousedown script is executed when the window is active and the pointing device button is pressed down on the window content area.

attribute.name: onmouseup
attribute.desc: The onmouseup script is executed when the window is active and the pointing device button is released over the window content area.
